title: 109_hr4711
content: The Act may be cited as the "Federal District Court of American Samoa Act of 2006" and establishes the Federal District Court for American Samoa. The Federal District Court of American Samoa is established as a court of record with jurisdiction similar to a district court of the United States, excluding cases involving communal lands or traditional chieftain titles. The Federal District Court and the High Court of American Samoa have concurrent jurisdiction over cases involving the interpretation of certain treaties and the constitution of American Samoa. The relationship between the courts of the United States and American Samoa is defined in terms of appeals, certiorari, removal of causes, and other legal proceedings. The issuance of writs of habeas corpus and other legal matters in American Samoa are governed by US laws regarding court relations between the US courts and state courts. SEC. 3. APPOINTMENT OF JUDGE, U.S. ATTORNEY, AND U.S. MARSHAL. The President appoints a judge for the Federal District Court of American Samoa for a 10-year term, with salary set by the United States. The Chief Judge of the Ninth Judicial Circuit can assign judges to local courts in American Samoa, with consent. The President appoints a judge for the Federal District Court of American Samoa for a 10-year term, with salary set by the United States. The Chief Judge of the Ninth Judicial Circuit can assign judges to local courts in American Samoa, with consent. Additionally, the President appoints a U.S. attorney and U.S. marshal for American Samoa, subject to Senate approval, with relevant provisions applying to their offices. SEC. 4. RULES OF PRACTICE AND PROCEDURE. The rules of practice and procedure from titles 11, 18, and 28, United States Code, apply to the Federal District Court of American Samoa and appeals, with adjustments for the Attorney General of American Samoa. SEC. 5. TECHNICAL AND CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. The Ninth Circuit in the table in section 41 of title 28, United States Code, is amended to include "American Samoa" after "Guam". Sections 373 and 376 of title 28 are amended to include the Federal District Court of American Samoa in retirement and survivors' annuities. Section 581(a)(15) of title 28 is amended to include "American Samoa" after "Guam". Section 610 of title 28 defines courts. Section 610 of title 28, United States Code, is amended to replace the United States District Court for the District of the Canal Zone with the Federal District Court of American Samoa. Additionally, amendments are made to sections regarding magistrate judges and court reporters to include the Federal District Court of American Samoa in their jurisdiction. Amendments are made to title 28, United States Code, to include the Federal District Court of American Samoa in various sections, such as Courts of Appeals and Interlocutory Decisions. Amendments to title 28, United States Code include adding the Federal District Court of American Samoa in various sections, such as Courts of Appeals and Interlocutory Decisions. Amendments to title 18, United States Code add the Federal District Court of American Samoa after the District Court of the Northern Mariana Islands. The term "American Samoa" in this Act includes Swains Island and Rose Island. The Act and its amendments will take effect 90 days after enactment.
